div.p: SAUCISSE, or Saucisson, in mining, is a long pipe or bag made of cloth well pitched, or ſometimes of leather, of about an inch and an halt diameter, filled with powder, going from the chamber of the mine to the entrance of the gallery. It is generally placed in a wooden pipe called an aυget, to prevent its growing damp. It ſerves to give fire to mines, caſſions, bomb-cheſts, &c.

Saucisson, is likewiſe a kind of faſcine, longer than the common ones; they ſerve to raiſe batteries and to repair breaches. They are alſo uſed in making epaulements, in flopping paſlages, and in making traverſes over a wet ditch, &c.
